data.title: Eliminator Week 2: Buh-bye BYU, Cal and over two dozen more
data.meta_description: BYU's failed two-point play against Utah cost it more than a win, it got the Cougars booted by the Eliminator. But BYU isn't the only one. We also say so long to Cal, UConn and many others.
data.text:
After the greatest opening weekend in college football history, many of us were ready to write off the SEC.

Among the myriad reasons: SEC East favorite Tennessee nearly lost to Appalachian State in overtime; Arkansas almost fell to Louisiana Tech; and LSU's offense was a hot mess in its loss to Wisconsin at Lambeau Field.

But Week 2 revealed that the SEC probably isn't quite that bad. Sure, Kentucky looks to be historically awful, and uninspired Georgia nearly lost to FCS foe Nicholls before pulling out a 26-24 win at home.

But No. 1 Alabama rolled an opponent for the second straight week, beating Western Kentucky 38-10. Arkansas upset No. 15 TCU 41-38 in two overtimes, and Tennessee rebounded to beat Virginia Tech 45-24 at Bristol Motor Speedway.

It's easy to overreact early in the season. What we do know to be the truth: Another 27 FBS teams have no chance of reaching the College Football Playoff. The Eliminator has now eliminated 56 of the 128 FBS teams from playoff consideration after only two weeks.

Among the casualties this week: Power 5 teams California, Kansas, NC State and Purdue. Better luck next week, guys.

Here's where FBS stands after Week 2:

Jump to Sections: Who's In | Still In Contention | On The Fence | Better Luck Next Season | Previously Eliminated

Who's in

Three of our four CFP teams are going to remain the same for the second straight week: No. 1 seed Alabama, No. 2 seed Florida State and No. 3 seed Michigan. But the No. 4 seed is going to change, with Ohio State replacing Houston. The Buckeyes beat Tulsa 48-3 at home, while the Cougars shut out FCS foe Lamar 42-0. The Buckeyes get their first big test at Oklahoma on Saturday. As long as the Cougars keep winning -- and get back injured quarterback Greg Ward Jr. soon -- they'll stay in the CFP mix. Clemson, which played Alabama for the CFP national championship last season, remains outside the top four after struggling on offense for the second week in a row in a 30-24 win over Troy.

Still in contention

Alabama Crimson Tide

Trending: EVEN

Imagine what Alabama coach Nick Saban might have done (and said) if his team had beaten Western Kentucky by only three touchdowns.

Clemson Tigers

Trending: DOWN

Yeah, that's Florida State in front of Clemson and Louisville in its rearview mirror. The Tigers better kick it in high gear in a hurry.

Florida State Seminoles

Trending: EVEN

FCS member Charleston Southern suspended 14 players from playing in its 52-8 loss at FSU because they improperly purchased school supplies from the bookstore. North Carolina suspended, well, never mind.

Houston Cougars

Trending: EVEN

With a trip to Cincinnati on Thursday night, all eyes will be on Cougars quarterback Greg Ward Jr., who didn't play in last week's 42-0 win over FCS foe Lamar because of a right shoulder injury.

Iowa Hawkeyes

Trending: EVEN

Iowa gave coach Kirk Ferentz a new 10-year, $49.5 million contract extension that might take him through the 2025 season. It also includes a $500,000 bonus if the Hawkeyes win eight games in a season. Suckers.

Louisville Cardinals

Trending: UP

After a record-setting start against Charlotte and Syracuse, Louisville quarterback Lamar Jackson moves from Keeneland to Churchill Downs this week. No. 2 Florida State is coming to town on Saturday night, along with ESPN's College GameDay.

Michigan Wolverines

Trending: EVEN

Remember that time Colorado quarterback Kordell Stewart threw that long pass to Michael Westbrook? The Buffaloes play at the Big House on Saturday.

Michigan State Spartans

Trending: EVEN

It has been 2,188 days since Michigan State defeated Notre Dame. But, hey, who's counting? The Spartans haven't won in the series since a 34-31 victory in overtime in 2010.

Ohio State Buckeyes

Trending: EVEN

It's almost criminal that Ohio State and Oklahoma have played each other only twice in their storied histories. Finally, after waiting 33 years, we'll get the third meeting in Norman, Oklahoma, on Saturday night.

Oklahoma Sooners

Trending: EVEN

Just like last season, the Sooners might be able to rebound from an early-season loss and still reach the CFP -- if they can knock off the Buckeyes at home on Saturday.

Stanford Cardinal

Trending: EVEN

No, you didn't miss another Christian McCaffrey highlight show late Saturday night. The Cardinal didn't play as they prepare for this week's showdown against USC at home.

Tennessee Volunteers

Trending: UP

After their disappointing overtime win over Appalachian State in Week 1, the Volunteers rebounded to knock off Virginia Tech 45-24 in front of a record crowd of 156,990 at Bristol Motor Speedway. They look like the team to beat again in the SEC East, but remember, "If you ain't first, you're last."

Texas Longhorns

Trending: EVEN

Let's make sure we have the extra-point kicks firmed up this week, Longhorns.

Texas A&M Aggies

Trending: EVEN

The Aggies upset then-No. 16 UCLA 31-24 in Week 1 and blasted FCS foe Prairie View A&M 67-0 in Week 2. But they opened as a four-point underdog at Auburn on Saturday. Remember, there's a reason Las Vegas has really tall buildings.

Washington Huskies

Trending: EVEN

Somebody tell Huskies coach Chris Petersen that he's not still coaching at Boise State. The Huskies played Rutgers and Idaho the first two weeks and they'll host FCS foe Portland State on Saturday night.

Wisconsin Badgers

Trending: UP

Man, the Badgers are sure lucky LSU didn't play that Purdue quarterback at Lambeau Field.

On the fence

Air Force Falcons

Trending: EVEN

Air Force's Timothy McVey returned a kickoff 99 yards for a touchdown in a 48-14 win over Georgia State. It was the Falcons' first kickoff return for a score since Oct. 9, 2010.

Arizona Wildcats

Trending: DOWN

That wasn't a typo on the Bottom Line late Saturday night: Arizona trailed FCS foe Grambling State 21-3 at the half. But the Wildcats scored 28 consecutive points, thanks in part to six Tigers turnovers, to escape with a 31-21 win.

Arizona State Sun Devils

Trending: UP

Here's what you missed in #Pac12AfterDark: Arizona State's Kalen Ballage tied a 26-year-old NCAA record with eight touchdowns in a 68-55 victory over Texas Tech. He had 185 all-purpose yards and ran 13 times for 137 yards with seven touchdowns.

Arkansas Razorbacks

Trending: UP

Dan Skipper, a 6-foot-10 offensive tackle, might have saved the Hogs' season when he blocked TCU's 28-yard field goal with 10 seconds remaining in the game. The Razorbacks beat the No. 15 Horned Frogs 41-38 in two overtimes.

Army Black Knights

Trending: UP

After defeating Rice 31-14 on Saturday, the Black Knights are 2-0 for the first time since 1996, when they won 10 games, the most in the academy's history. Army has already matched its win total from last season.

Auburn Tigers

Trending: UP

A week after struggling mightily on offense, the Tigers piled up 706 yards of offense in a 51-14 rout of Arkansas State, the second-highest total in school history. They had 712 yards of offense against Western Carolina in 2013.

Baylor Bears

Trending: EVEN

The Bears still haven't played anyone of consequence yet, and won't until they play Oklahoma State at home in two weeks. But they're still one of only three unbeaten teams left in the Big 12.

Boise State Broncos

Trending: UP

Don't sleep on the Broncos. They knocked off Washington State 31-28 last week and play at Oregon State on Saturday. Boise State and San Diego State don't play during the regular season, but might be on a collision course for the Mountain West Conference championship game.

Boston College Eagles

Trending: EVEN

After losing to Georgia Tech in Ireland, the Eagles stayed close to home and won 26-7 at Massachusetts, their first victory since beating Northern Illinois 17-14 on Sept. 26, 2015.

Central Michigan Chippewas

Trending: UP

Who cares if officials completely bungled the ending of the Chippewas' 30-27 upset of Oklahoma State? Colorado still counts its 33-31 win over Missouri in 1990.

Cincinnati Bearcats

Trending: EVEN

The Bearcats' 38-20 win at Purdue on Saturday was their first road victory over a Big Ten opponent since winning at Indiana in 1957.

Colorado Buffaloes

Trending: UP

After beating up Colorado State and Idaho State in its first two games, Colorado is about to take a big step up in competition. The Buffaloes play consecutive road games at No. 4 Michigan and No. 22 Oregon the next two weeks.

Duke Blue Devils

Trending: DOWN

It looks like it might be a long season for the rebuilding Blue Devils. They've turned the ball over eight times in their first two games.

East Carolina Pirates

Trending: UP

After defeating NC State 33-30, the Pirates have won six consecutive games against ACC foes. They'll get a chance to make it seven straight when they play at Virginia Tech on Sept. 24.

Florida Gators

Trending: UP

Yeah, the Gators looked good against Kentucky, just like they did in each of the previous 29 seasons. We're reserving judgment until after their Sept. 24 trip to Tennessee.

Georgia Bulldogs

Trending: DOWN

The Bulldogs survived a 26-24 win over FCS foe Nicholls in coach Kirby Smart's home debut. Georgia was favored to win by 55 points. The Bulldogs can't blame that one on Mark Richt.

Georgia Southern Eagles

Trending: UP

Easy, Eagles. It's a little premature to call yourselves the best FBS team in the state.

Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets

Trending: EVEN

After beating FCS foe Mercer 35-10 last week, the Yellow Jackets host Vanderbilt on Saturday. Georgia Tech hasn't lost to the Commodores since 1941, going 11-0-1 since then.

Illinois Fighting Illini

Trending: DOWN

After losing to North Carolina 48-23, the Illini will try to avoid becoming the second straight Big Ten team to lose to Western Michigan, which knocked off Northwestern 22-21 in Week 1.

Indiana Hoosiers

Trending: EVEN

A big sign of progress for the IU defense: It already has forced six takeaways in two games after getting only 22 in 13 games in 2015.

Kansas State Wildcats

Trending: EVEN

The Wildcats had an extra week to fix their mistakes from their opening loss at Stanford. They'll have more time to get better in consecutive nonconference games against Florida Atlantic and FCS foe Missouri State.

LSU Tigers

Trending: EVEN

Quarterback Danny Etling, who was 2-10 in his 12 games as a starter at Purdue in 2013-14, came off the bench to lead the Tigers to a 34-13 win over FCS foe Jacksonville State. Tigers coach Les Miles hasn't said whether Etling will start Saturday night's SEC opener against Mississippi State.

Marshall Thundering Herd

Trending: EVEN

After beating FCS foe Morgan State 62-0, the Thundering Herd play Akron on Saturday, before back-to-back games against ACC foes Louisville (home) and Pittsburgh (road).

Maryland Terrapins

Trending: EVEN

There's a good matchup of first-year coaches in Orlando, Florida, this week: Maryland's D.J. Durkin vs. UCF's Scott Frost.

Memphis Tigers

Trending: UP

After beating FCS member Southeast Missouri State 35-17 in their opener, the Tigers had the weekend off. They'll play Kansas at home on Saturday.

Miami Hurricanes

Trending: EVEN

Somebody owes new Hurricanes coach Mark Richt an apology. Miami's trip to Appalachian State doesn't look scary or anything.

Minnesota Golden Gophers

Trending: EVEN

Junior college transfer Kobe McCrary, who led the country with 22 touchdowns at Butler (Kansas) Community College last year, ran 17 times for 176 yards with two touchdowns in a 58-28 rout of FCS foe Indiana State.

Missouri Tigers

Trending: EVEN

Missouri's Drew Lock is the only SEC quarterback averaging more than 300 passing yards per game. He threw for 450 yards with a school-record five touchdown passes in a 61-21 rout of Eastern Michigan last week.

Navy Midshipmen

Trending: EVEN

New starting quarterback Will Worth wasn't bad in his first start, running for 44 yards with two touchdowns and completing 6 of 8 passes for 130 yards in a 28-24 win over UConn.

Nebraska Cornhuskers

Trending: UP

Nebraska coach Mike Riley will meet a familiar foe in Saturday's home game against Oregon. He was 4-10 against the Ducks as Oregon State's coach in two different stints.

North Carolina Tar Heels

Trending: UP

The Tar Heels must have really taken something out of Georgia in Week 1.

Notre Dame Fighting Irish

Trending: UP

Notre Dame's secondary suffered another big blow when starting cornerback Shaun Crawford was lost for the season with a torn Achilles tendon in last week's 39-10 win over Nevada. Starting safety Max Redfield was dismissed from the team following his arrest during preseason camp.

Oklahoma State Cowboys

Trending: DOWN

What was the biggest surprise from the Pokes' getting jobbed in their 30-27 loss to Central Michigan? OSU coach Mike Gundy took it like a man. Well done.

Ole Miss Rebels

Trending: EVEN

Don't worry, Rebels. I'm sure Alabama coach Nick Saban probably doesn't remember that you beat his teams in each of the past two seasons.

Oregon Ducks

Trending: EVEN

Olympic hurdler Devon Allen, fresh off the Rio Games, caught four passes for 141 yards with one touchdown in the Ducks' 44-26 win over Virginia. He joins Florida A&M's Bob Hayes (1964), West Virginia's James Jett (1992) and Texas' Marquise Goodman (2012) as active NCAA players who competed in the Olympics.

Oregon State Beavers

Trending: EVEN

The Beavers had a week off after losing to Minnesota 30-23 in Week 1. After losing 10 straight games, they should finally get into the victory column against FCS foe Idaho State on Saturday.

Penn State Nittany Lions

Trending: DOWN

Penn State's offensive line might be a little motivated this week. The Nittany Lions allowed 10 sacks in a 27-10 loss at Temple last season, which was Penn State's first to the Owls in 74 years.

Pittsburgh Panthers

Trending: UP

So that's why Penn State doesn't want to play Pitt every year (or is it vice versa?).

Rutgers Scarlet Knights

Trending: DOWN

FCS member Howard led by two touchdowns in the first quarter, before the Scarlet Knights exploded for 52 straight points for a 52-14 win.

San Diego State Aztecs

Trending: UP

It might be time to add San Diego State tailback Donnel Pumphrey to the list of Heisman Trophy candidates. He ran for 281 yards with three touchdowns in the Aztecs' 45-40 win over California. He passed Marshall Faulk to become the school's all-time rushing leader, and he's the active leader in FBS in rushing yards, rushing touchdowns and 100-yard games.

South Carolina Gamecocks

Trending: UP

The Gamecocks lost 27-14 at Mississippi State last week, but might have found themselves a quarterback. Freshman Brandon McIlwain came off the bench and threw for 126 yards with two touchdowns on 11-for-22 passing.

South Florida Bulls

Trending: UP

The best individual performance you might have missed on Saturday: USF quarterback Quinton Flowers passed for 350 yards with four touchdowns and ran for 53 yards in a 48-17 win over Northern Illinois.

Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles

Trending: UP

The Golden Eagles allowed 41 yards of offense, the fewest ever surrendered in a game in Conference USA history, and only three first downs in a 56-0 rout of FCS foe Savannah State on Saturday.

Syracuse Orange

Trending: DOWN

The Orange are definitely playing faster under first-year coach Dino Babers. But the Syracuse defense also gave up points pretty quickly in a 62-28 loss to Louisville at home on Friday night.

TCU Horned Frogs

Trending: DOWN

The Horned Frogs allowed 82 points in their first two games. They didn't allow that many points until their 10th game in 2010, when they went 13-0 and won the Rose Bowl.

Texas State Bobcats

Trending: EVEN

The Bobcats had an extra week to prepare for a grueling two-game stretch in which they'll play at No. 24 Arkansas and host No. 6 Houston.

Texas Tech Red Raiders

Trending: DOWN

Red Raiders quarterback Patrick Mahomes is on pace to throw for 6,649 yards in 13 games, which would shatter the FBS single-season record of 5,833, set by Texas Tech's B.J. Symons in 2003.

Toledo Rockets

Trending: EVEN

The balance of power in the MAC might have shifted to the West. The Rockets are one of three 2-0 teams in the West Division; every team in the East has already suffered at least one loss.

UCLA Bruins

Trending: EVEN

The Bruins have to be breathing a sigh of relief after last week's 42-21 win over UNLV. Defensive tackle Eddie Vanderdoes left the game with a left knee injury, but it's believed to be only a strain.

USC Trojans

Trending: UP

The Trojans bounced back from a dismal opener against Alabama by beating Utah State 45-7 last week. They're headed in the right direction going into Saturday night's Pac-12 opener at Stanford. The Cardinal have won six of the past eight games in the series.

Utah Utes

Trending: UP

The Utes' sixth consecutive victory over BYU was hardly a work of art. Utah threw three interceptions and fumbled six times, losing three, in an ugly 20-19 victory.

Vanderbilt Commodores

Trending: UP

Vanderbilt's Ralph Webb ran for 211 yards with two touchdowns in a 47-24 win over Middle Tennessee State, becoming only the third player in school history to run for more than 200 yards in a game. Frank Mordica was the last Vandy player to do it with 321 yards against Air Force in 1978.

Virginia Tech Hokies

Trending: EVEN

There were plenty of good things for the Hokies to take away from their 45-24 loss to Tennessee at Bristol Motor Speedway. They raced out to a 14-0 lead in the first quarter and piled up 400 yards of offense. But they're not going to beat anybody turning the ball over five times.

Wake Forest Demon Deacons

Trending: UP

After beating Tulane 7-3 in their opener, the Demon Deacons had an offensive explosion in Week 2. They scored three touchdowns in a 24-14 win at Duke.

West Virginia Mountaineers

Trending: EVEN

West Virginia fans didn't get to see Bo Pelini's cat, but they did get to see a sideline tirade in the Mountaineers' 38-21 win over the Penguins.

Western Michigan Broncos

Trending: EVEN

After losing 15 games in a row to Big Ten foes before this season, the Broncos can win two straight when they play at Illinois on Saturday. They knocked off Northwestern 22-21 in their opener.

Better luck next season

Akron Zips

Trending: DOWN

Don't worry, Zips, you're not the only ones who didn't know the Badgers would be this good.

Ball State Cardinals

Trending: EVEN

The Cardinals lost 30-20 at Indiana, but they might still be better than Purdue.

BYU Cougars

Trending: EVEN

That's one way to put your stamp on a program. After the Cougars pulled to within 20-19 of Utah with 17 seconds left in the Holy War, first-year coach Kalani Sitake decided to go for a win. Unfortunately for him, Cougars quarterback Taysom Hill was stuffed short of the end zone.

Cal Bears

Trending: EVEN

The Bears are allowing an average of 291 rushing yards per game, which is about 40 more than any other Power 5 school. They host No. 11 Texas next week.

Connecticut Huskies

Trending:EVEN

Down 28-24 to Navy on Saturday, the Huskies had the ball at Navy's 1-yard line with 17 seconds left. Somehow, they used all 17 seconds for no gain.

Eastern Michigan Eagles

Trending: DOWN

If the Eagles don't start playing better, Central Michigan and Western Michigan might disown them. They're giving Directional U. a bad name.

Florida Atlantic Owls

Trending: DOWN

The Driskel family vs. Miami: 613 yards, two touchdowns, five interceptions and a 0-3 record (courtesy of ESPN colleague David Hale).

Idaho Vandals

Trending: DOWN

The Vandals were walloped 59-14 at Washington Saturday. The good news: They get to play at Washington State next week.

Kansas Jayhawks

Trending: DOWN

Yeah, they probably should have let the Kansas students tear down the goalposts last week. The Jayhawks lost to Ohio 37-21 on Saturday.

Louisiana Monroe Warhawks

Trending: DOWN

Hey, at least the Warhawks didn't have to play Nicholls this past week.

Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders

Trending: DOWN

With all due respect, it might be time to re-evaluate the defensive game plan after allowing 47 points to Vanderbilt.

Nevada Wolf Pack

Trending: DOWN

Nevada's Ahki Muhammad needs to send Clemson's Ray-Ray McCloud a thank-you note. Muhammad made an equally boneheaded play when he caught a kickoff and carried it out of the end zone, only to step back into the end zone and take a knee for a safety.

New Mexico Lobos

Trending: DOWN

The Lobos blew a 9-point lead in the fourth quarter and lost to New Mexico State 32-31, their first loss to their instate rivals since 2011.

NC State Wolfpack

Trending: DOWN

The Wolfpack shouldn't feel too bad about losing to East Carolina again. The Pirates have also beaten ACC foes North Carolina and Virginia Tech twice since 2013.

Old Dominion Monarchs

Trending: DOWN

Yeah, it probably wasn't a good week to play Appalachian State.

Purdue Boilermakers

Trending: DOWN

No, you're not seeing things, Purdue fans. Somehow, there is a team (winless Northwestern) below you in the Big Ten West standings.

SMU Mustangs

Trending: DOWN

The Mustangs lost 40-13 at Baylor on Saturday. They play FCS foe Liberty next week in the second date of their Baptist university tour.

South Alabama Jaguars

Trending: DOWN

Yeah, I'm guessing there were more than a few bottles of Zing Zang consumed in Mobile, Alabama, last week. A week after beating Mississippi State, the Jaguars still seemed to be celebrating until losing to Georgia Southern 24-9.

Texas San Antonio Roadrunners

Trending: DOWN

The Roadrunners had minus-1 rushing yards after allowing six sacks in a 23-14 loss at Colorado State.

Troy Trojans

Trending: UP

The Trojans should have known they weren't going to be on the right end of a borderline call at Clemson -- or two or three.

Tulsa Golden Hurricane

Trending: EVEN

Look on the bright side: Tulsa's defense kept Ohio State's vaunted offense out of the end zone during the entire first half and then some.

UCF Knights

Trending: DOWN

First-year UCF coach Scott Frost said his players hit harder than Michigan's in a 51-14 loss at the Big House. Yeah, but the Wolverines ran, passed, caught, blocked and kicked better than the Knights.

UNLV Rebels

Trending: UP

The Rebels are already showing marked improvement under second-year coach Tony Sanchez. UCLA had only a 7-point lead in the fourth quarter before pulling away for a 42-21 win.

Utah State Aggies

Trending: DOWN

The Aggies' 45-7 loss at USC might have been very costly. Star running back Devante Mays, who ran for 208 yards with three touchdowns in Week 1, left the game with a leg injury and was using crutches on the sideline.

UTEP Miners

Trending: DOWN

The Miners made a smart move by resting injured quarterback Zack Greenlee (knee) before the start of Conference USA play. He probably wouldn't have made much of a difference in a 41-7 loss at Texas.

Western Kentucky Hilltoppers

Trending: EVEN

The Hilltoppers lost at Alabama by four touchdowns, but they did enough good things to tick off Crimson Tide coach Nick Saban.

Wyoming Cowboys

Trending: DOWN

Talk about a nightmare: The Cowboys trailed Nebraska 17-10 in the second half, but then had turnovers on six of their last seven possessions. Wyoming quarterback Josh Allen threw five interceptions and fumbled a lateral.

Previously eliminated
